article_text:
One thing that distinguishes Americans from every other nationality is our obsession with fixing things that aren’t actually broken. Inherently restless, we are always trying to improve things that may be fine just as they are: baseball, the national anthem, orange juice cartons, scones.

That said, change is good. Or let’s just say that the possibility of change is good. When traditions become frozen in time, they tend to atrophy. Bowling used to be an incredibly popular sport, but it didn’t change with the times and has...

twitter.description: It’s time to take a closer look at our Thanksgiving rituals, writes Joe Queenan. How about paella instead of turkey once in a while?
twitter.title: A Plan to Fix Thanksgiving

image.alt: Joe Queenan’s plan to fix Thanksgiving

article_summary:
Bowling used to be an incredibly popular sport, but it didn’t change with the times and has...
One thing that distinguishes Americans from every other nationality is our obsession with fixing things that aren’t actually broken.
Or let’s just say that the possibility of change is good.
Inherently restless, we are always trying to improve things that may be fine just as they are: baseball, the national anthem, orange juice cartons, scones.
That said, change is good.
